value.title: Combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to combine Power BI Report Tooltips using DAX. Just a little bit of DAX! This can be useful when you want to use a single report tooltip for multiple Power BI visuals.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI! value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how you can trace your DAX queries when trying to troubleshoot or optimize Power BI reports and datasets. There are a few options and Adam walks you through them. value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop

Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

value.title: DAX CrossFilter Function in Power BI   Write the Formula both directional but keep the relationship

value.title: Explicit Vs Implicit DAX Measures in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you ever tried to connect to a Power BI dataset from Excel using Analyze in Excel? if yes, you might have had this experience that your values don’t show in Excel’s Pivot table as values. This is because those values are not explicit measures, they are implicit measures in Power BI. In this article

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: AddColumns is a DAX function that is helpful often when writing calculations in Power BI. In this article and video, I’ll explain how you can use it to add calculated columns on the fly to the virtual tables in measures or directly in a table. download the Power BI file from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/how-to-use-addcolumns-function-in-dax-and-power-bi
